meanings.definition: Not able to be renewed or replaced.
meanings.sent1: The nonrenewable battery died after a single use.
meanings.sent2: The scientist explained that fossil fuels are nonrenewable resources.
meanings.sent3: The nonrenewable light bulb refused to shine again.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was as nonrenewable as a one-time offer.
meanings.sent5: The nonrenewable warranty expired before she could use it.

meanings.definition: A resource that cannot be replenished within a human lifetime.
meanings.sent1: The country heavily relied on nonrenewable resources for energy.
meanings.sent2: The environmentalist advocated for the reduction of nonrenewable resource consumption.
meanings.sent3: The nonrenewable oil reserve seemed to mock the researchers.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was a nonrenewable well that never ran dry.
meanings.sent5: The value of time felt as nonrenewable as precious gems.
